edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck

Class WorldController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck.WorldController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EditController, GameController, LevelSelect, MenuMode, SettingsScreen

    public abstract class WorldController
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    Base class for a world-specific controller. A world has its own objects, assets, and input controller. Thus this is really a mini-GameEngine in its own right. The only thing that it does not do is create a GameCanvas; that is shared with the main application. You will notice that asset loading is not done with static methods this time. Instance asset loading makes it easier to process our game modes in a loop, which is much more scalable. However, we still want the assets themselves to be static. This is the purpose of our AssetState variable; it ensures that multiple instances place nicely with the static assets.

    • Method Detail

      • preLoadContent

        public void preLoadContent(com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager manager)
        Preloads the assets for this controller. To make the game modes more for-loop friendly, we opted for nonstatic loaders this time. However, we still want the assets themselves to be static. So we have an AssetState that determines the current loading state. If the assets are already loaded, this method will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        manager - Reference to global asset manager.

      • loadContent

        public void loadContent(com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager manager)
        Loads the assets for this controller. To make the game modes more for-loop friendly, we opted for nonstatic loaders this time. However, we still want the assets themselves to be static. So we have an AssetState that determines the current loading state. If the assets are already loaded, this method will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        manager - Reference to global asset manager.

      • unloadContent

        public void unloadContent(com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager manager)
        Unloads the assets for this game. This method erases the static variables. It also deletes the associated textures from the asset manager. If no assets are loaded, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        manager - Reference to global asset manager.

      • isDebug

        public boolean isDebug()
        Returns true if debug mode is active. If true, all objects will display their physics bodies.
        Returns:
        true if debug mode is active.

        Sets whether debug mode is active. If true, all objects will display their physics bodies.

      • setCanvas

        public void setCanvas(GameCanvas canvas)
        Sets the canvas associated with this controller The canvas is shared across all controllers. Setting this value will compute the drawing scale from the canvas size.
        Parameters:
        canvas - the canvas associated with this controller

        Dispose of all (non-static) resources allocated to this mode.

      • addQueuedObject

        public void addQueuedObject(Obstacle obj)
        Adds a physics object in to the insertion queue. Objects on the queue are added just before collision processing. We do this to control object creation. param obj The object to add

      • inBounds

        public boolean inBounds(Obstacle obj)
        Returns true if the object is in bounds. This assertion is useful for debugging the physics.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to check.
        Returns:
        true if the object is in bounds.

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        Resets the status of the game so that we can play again. This method disposes of the world and creates a new one.

      • preUpdate

        public boolean preUpdate(float dt)
        Returns whether to process the update loop At the start of the update loop, we check if it is time to switch to a new game mode. If not, the update proceeds normally.
        Parameters:
        dt - Number of seconds since last animation frame
        Returns:
        whether to process the update loop

      • update

        public abstract void update(float dt)
        The core gameplay loop of this world. This method contains the specific update code for this mini-game. It does not handle collisions, as those are managed by the parent class WorldController. This method is called after input is read, but before collisions are resolved. The very last thing that it should do is apply forces to the appropriate objects.
        Parameters:
        dt - Number of seconds since last animation frame

      • postUpdate

        public void postUpdate(float dt)
        Processes physics Once the update phase is over, but before we draw, we are ready to handle physics. The primary method is the step() method in world. This implementation works for all applications and should not need to be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        dt - Number of seconds since last animation frame

      • draw

        public void draw(float delta)
        Draw the physics objects to the canvas For simple worlds, this method is enough by itself. It will need to be overriden if the world needs fancy backgrounds or the like. The method draws all objects in the order that they were added.
        Parameters:
        delta - The drawing context

      • resize

        public void resize(int width,
                   int height)
        Called when the Screen is resized. This can happen at any point during a non-paused state but will never happen before a call to show().
        Specified by:
        resize in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Parameters:
        width - The new width in pixels
        height - The new height in pixels

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        Called when the Screen should render itself. We defer to the other methods update() and draw(). However, it is VERY important that we only quit AFTER a draw.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Parameters:
        delta - Number of seconds since last animation frame

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Called when the Screen is paused. This is usually when it's not active or visible on screen. An Application is also paused before it is destroyed.
        Specified by:
        pause in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Called when the Screen is resumed from a paused state. This is usually when it regains focus.
        Specified by:
        resume in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • show

        public void show()
        Called when this screen becomes the current screen for a Game.
